DataElement.preferredName: Increase Male Reproductive System Therapy-Related Toxicity Adverse Event Severity Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The increased therapy related toxicity severity grade to the male reproductive system.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Increase Male Reproductive System Therapy-Related Toxicity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.:The sex organs of the male._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

Concepts.definition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.

Property.preferredDefinition: The sex organs of the male._The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.

Concepts.definition: The sex organs of the male.
The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used._Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Grade 0 is universally defined as absence of Adverse Events or within normal limits or values.

Concepts.definition: The absence of adverse events or within normal limits or values.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adverse event that is asymptomatic; or involves mild or minor symptoms; or is of marginal clinical relevance; or consists of clinical or diagnostic observations alone; or for which intervention is not indicated; or for which only non-prescription intervention is indicated.

Concepts.definition: An adverse event that is asymptomatic; or involves mild or minor symptoms; or is of marginal clinical relevance; or consists of clinical or diagnostic observations alone; or for which intervention is not indicated; or for which only non-prescription intervention is indicated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adverse event for which only minimal, local, or noninvasive intervention (e.g. packing, cautery) is indicated; or that limits instrumental activities of daily living (ADLs, e.g., shopping, laundry, transportation, or ability to conduct finances).

Concepts.definition: An adverse event for which only minimal, local, or noninvasive intervention (e.g. packing, cautery) is indicated; or that limits instrumental activities of daily living (ADLs, e.g., shopping, laundry, transportation, or ability to conduct finances).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adverse event that is medically significant but not life-threatening; or for which inpatient care or prolongation of hospitalization are indicated; or that is an important medical event that does not result in hospitalization, but may jeopardize the patient or may require intervention either to prevent hospitalization, to prevent the AE from becoming life-threatening or causing death; or that is disabling; or that results in persistent or significant disability, incapacity, or limitation of self care activities of daily living (ADLs, e.g., getting in and out of bed, dressing, eating, getting around inside, bathing, or using the toilet).

Concepts.definition: An adverse event that is medically significant but not life-threatening; or for which inpatient care or prolongation of hospitalization are indicated; or that is an important medical event that does not result in hospitalization, but may jeopardize the patient or may require intervention either to prevent hospitalization, to prevent the AE from becoming life-threatening or causing death; or that is disabling; or that results in persistent or significant disability, incapacity, or limitation of self care activities of daily living (ADLs, e.g., getting in and out of bed, dressing, eating, getting around inside, bathing, or using the toilet).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The termination of life associated with an adverse event.

Concepts.definition: The termination of life associated with an adverse event.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adverse event that has life-threatening consequences; for which urgent intervention is indicated; that puts the patient at risk of death at the time of the event if immediate intervention is not undertaken.

Concepts.definition: An adverse event that has life-threatening consequences; for which urgent intervention is indicated; that puts the patient at risk of death at the time of the event if immediate intervention is not undertaken.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Adverse Event Severity Adverse Event Grade
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.
